document.masterDocTitle: Dorcadion axillare Küster, 1847 (Coleoptera, Cerambycidae): distribution, morphometrics, karyotype and description of a new subspecies from Romania

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Dorcadion axillare Küster, 1847 (Coleoptera, Cerambycidae): distribution, morphometrics, karyotype and description of a new subspecies from Romania

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined. According to the original description (
Küster 1847
) the type locality of
Dorcadion axillare
is situated in the Balkan Mountains (Stara Planina), Bulgaria . The following specimens were examined:
Bulgaria
: Stara Zagora, leg. G. Murzov,
5 . IV.2005
, 23;
11 . IV.2005
, 13 2 Ƥ;
26 .III–08. IV.2007
, 63 4 Ƥ (first author’s collection); Shipka Pass, leg. M. Hradský, 13 ; Shipka Pass, leg. Netolitzky, 1 Ƥ 13 ; Shipka, 1400m , leg. Kohoušek,
19 .VI.1963
, 13 1 Ƥ; Kazanlak, leg. Kohoušek,
18 .VI.1963
, 13; unreadable locality, leg. V. Petrov,
14 . VI.1958
, 1Ƥ; Sofia and surroundings, V.1930, 1 Ƥ; Vitosha, Dragalevtsi, leg. I. Buresch,
31 .V.1912
, 1Ƥ; Orechovice, leg. Hanus,
2 .VI. 19
?, 1 Ƥ; Vratsa, Balkan, leg. Štěrba,
31 .V. 1906
?, 13 ; Varna, leg. Jureček & H. Jurečková, 23 ; Varna, 13 ; no precise locality, M. Hradský, 43 ( NMP ); Varna, 23 ; no precise locality, 13 ; lectotype Ƥ of
Dorcadion litigiosum
var. varnarum Pic
, present designation: ‘Warna Bulgarie’, ‘Dorcadio Decipiens Germ’, ‘
litigiosum
v. varnarum
Pic’ [Pic’s handwriting], ‘type’ [Pic’s handwriting], ‘Museum Paris Coll M. Pic’, ‘Type’ [red label] ( MNHN ); Varna, 8 Ƥ ( ZMHU ); Shipka Pass, leg. Netolitzky, 13 ( MHNB ); Sliven, 13 ( NHMW ). Balkans : no precise locality, leg. Nickerl, 13 ( NMP ); no precise locality, 63 1 Ƥ ( MNHN ); no precise locality, 13 4 Ƥ; Thracia, 1 Ƥ ( NHMW ).
Romania
: S. Dobruja, Esechioi, leg. N. Sävulescu,
14 .V.1962
, 13;
8 .V.1966
, 13;
26–29 .V. 1982
, 763 10 Ƥ; 26–29 . V.1982, 2 Ƥ;
26 .V.1982
, 3Ƥ; S. Dobruja, Hagieni, leg. N. Sävulescu,
29 .V.1963
, 13;
29 .VI.1963
, 13;
21 .V.1965
, 13; leg. M. Andrieş?,
24 .IV.1995
, 1Ƥ; leg. C. Pârvu,
1 .V.1980
, 13; SW Dobruja, Oltina, leg. N. Sävulescu,
13 .V.1958
, 1Ƥ;
14 .V.1959
, 1Ƥ; Caraş Severin, Ocolul Silvic Valea Beiului, leg. M. Stan,
15 .V.2002
, 13; S. Dobruja, Bugeac, leg. N. Sävulescu,
4 .VI.1960
, 1Ƥ; N. Dobruja, Babadag, leg. N. Sävulescu,
23 .VI.1955
, 23;
28 .V.1960
, 13;
1 .VI.1963
, 2Ƥ; Constanţa, Histria, leg. Al. Iftime,
27 .V.1995
, 1Ƥ; Dobruja, Mangalia, A. L. Montandon, 13 ( MHNB ); Dobrudja, 13 ( MNHN ); Dobruja, leg. Merkl, 1882, 1Ƥ ( NHMW ); Mangalia, leg. M. Nicodym,
2 .V.1986
, 13 (a photograph of this specimen was kindly provided by M. L. Danilevsky who keeps it in his collection).

Specimens from Bulgaria and South Romania are small with a mean male body length = 11.55 mm (n = 41 ) and mean female body length = 13.04 mm (n = 23 ), and a short pronotum in males ( 0.82–1 times as long as wide at base, mean = 0.94 , n = 41 ); pronotal lateral protuberances are blunt or with short spines (
Figs 5
j–l, 6 a–c,
Table 1
). The populations have both autochrome and androchrome females and sometimes autochrome females predominate (in a large series of specimens collected on the same day from Esechioi, there are three androchrome females and twelve autochrome females).

Dorcadion litigiosum
var. varnarum Pic
was described based on an unstated number of females from Varna, Bulgaria (
Pic 1926
). It was considered as a morph of
D. axillare
by
Breuning ( 1962 )
and as a synonym of
D. axillare
by
Danilevsky ( 2010 )
. In order to preserve the stability of nomenclature, the unique specimen in MNHN that bears an identification label and a type label in Pic’s handwriting is here designated lectotype . It is an autochrome female of
D. axillare
, with grayish background pubescence on elytra (
Fig. 2
).
